definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: The intelligence service conceived a grand design to assassinate the War Minister.
sentences.chinese: 情報機構策劃了一項暗殺陸軍部長的重大計劃。

sentences.english: Assassination is the extreme form of censorship.
sentences.chinese: 暗殺是審查的極端形式。

sentences.english: He was mowed down by the assassin at point-blank range.
sentences.chinese: 他被暗殺者的近距離開槍打死。

sentences.english: King was assassinated six months later.
Mr. Uribe, one of the targets of the alleged assassination plots, reacted cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 暗殺陰謀的目標之一烏力貝對此反應謹慎。

sentences.english: Bai Chen whether had escaped to assassinate?
Who is the assassin who appears to be stalking Roslin in "Colonial Day"?
sentences.chinese: 誰是在殖民地日接近羅斯林的暗殺者？

sentences.english: Vos voyaged to Coruscant to kill Senator Kaa, but Windu stopped Vos in time.
sentences.chinese: 昆蘭前往科洛桑暗殺卡議員，所幸被溫杜及時制止。

sentences.english: Kennedy was shot from a warehouse and his assassin ran and hid in a theater.
sentences.chinese: 刺客躲在倉庫裏暗殺甘迺迪後逃走躲進一間戲院裏。

sentences.english: Nobody ever tried to assassinate me.
sentences.chinese: 至今沒有人試圖暗殺我。

sentences.english: Che Khan, ruler of the Khans, orders the assassination of the newborn baby of the Maraji s.
sentences.chinese: 汗國的統治者車可汗下令暗殺這個馬拉吉家的新生兒。

sentences.english: Each new day brings another plot to assassinate me and bring us closer to anarchy and terror.
sentences.chinese: 日日有人謀劃暗殺我，將國家逼向動亂和恐怖。

sentences.english: Stromgarde forces lead an unsuccessful assassination attempt on Ogre-mage Cho'Gall.
sentences.chinese: 斯托姆加德王國的部隊試圖暗殺食人魔法師仇高。

sentences.english: On July 15, 1946, he was assassinated in kunming by Kuomintang thugs.
sentences.chinese: 一九四六年七月十五日在昆明被國民黨特務暗殺。

sentences.english: Elections have become long spells of organised thuggery.
sentences.chinese: 各類選舉已經成爲組織性暗殺活動的特定行動期。

sentences.english: He was assassinated in 1989 by a female Tamil terrorist.
sentences.chinese: 1989年，拉吉夫被一名泰米爾女性恐怖分子暗殺。

definition: to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to rake with machine gunfire/to strafe/to machine-gun down
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
group of people/camp/faction/sides in a dispute
